revised_title: James Eric Smith: A Pioneering Invertebrate Zoologist and Marine Biologist
tldr: James Eric Smith was a renowned invertebrate zoologist and marine biologist who made significant contributions to the field of zoology. Born in Hull, he was the first in his family to enter academic life and pursued his passion for science at King's College, London. Smith's career included working at Plymouth Laboratory, holding positions at various universities, and making lasting impacts on the lives of his students and colleagues. His interests extended to gardening, music, and the history of Victorian naturalists, and he was known for his love of people and his ability to connect with others.
